page.title: 07THE FORESTRY COMMISSION.
page.content: The Forestry Commission was founded in {1919}just after the First World War. It was set up to replant the forests that had been destroyed to supply the demand for wood in the years of the first World War. In the 1950's this changed when the Forestry Commission decided to try to increase the amount of wood produced in this country as {96% }was imported from other countries. The aim of the Forestry Commission is to produce {ALL the wood needed in this country and to get more jobs for the unemployed. The Forestry Commission don't just plant trees they make paths and walks for people to look at and enjoy the many forests. There are{18 branches}of the Forestry Commission throughout the whole of Scotland.{
